class_notes: This course will provide a comprehensive overview of the writings of the seventeenth-century English poet John Milton, including his early lyric poetry, prose writings, and late major works. Much of the course will be devoted to a complete reading of Milton's masterpiece, the Biblical epic Paradise Lost. We will address his writing within its historical context, paying special attention to Milton's role in the English Civil War "during which he served as Latin secretary for the revolutionary Commonwealth government and was among the chief advocates of Puritan and republican values" and his relation to the changing gender roles of his time. We will also consider the major philosophical and religious themes of his writing, such as free will and the nature of divine providence.
course_description: Selected major works (poetry and prose) with particular emphasis on the early lyric verse, Comus, Paradise Lost, and Samson Agonistes.
